DataElement.preferredName: Or Adverse Event Product Problem Safety Report Document Version Report Nullification Flag ISO21090.BL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Specifies whether the report cancels a previously sent adverse event.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Or Adverse Event Product Problem Safety Report Document Version Report Nullification Flag
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.:The state of being certain that adverse effects will not be caused by some agent under defined conditions.:A short textual account; having provided a short account.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of work.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._Action(s) undertaken to indicate that a previously transmitted report should be considered completely void (nullified).:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Or Adverse Event Product Problem Safety Report Document Version
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.:The state of being certain that adverse effects will not be caused by some agent under defined conditions.:A short textual account; having provided a short account.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of work.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.
The state of being certain that adverse effects will not be caused by some agent under defined conditions.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Property.preferredDefinition: Action(s) undertaken to indicate that a previously transmitted report should be considered completely void (nullified).:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Concepts.definition: Action(s) undertaken to indicate that a previously transmitted report should be considered completely void (nullified).
An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per  model owner approval. mc 2/2/11

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 2/19/13 Added AIM Foundation Model CSI reference. jc
